page.title: 15 A Stallholder's Life
page.content: Flowerstall passed down in family from Grandfather to father to son. Grandfather worked in Lewisham before there was a market.He sold flowers from a basket years before the 2nd world war.Lewisham Market has now been licensed for 53 years.The stalls are mostly owned by long-standing families.The week begins"going up the road"(i.e.buying the flowers from Covent Garden,Nine Elms). When buying,a price is given & the buyer bids for the lower price but always looking for the best quality.Once the buying is done the flowers are taken to be "stood up"in water in a cool,dry shed.This happens most as fresh flowers are al always bought when needed.The stall has to be packed out quickly & expertly Trading is from 9.00am to 6.00pm.There are many regular customers.
